posts.com:
Storytime, /fit/

I'm a massive weeaboo faggot, so I'm writing a story about a 30yo KHV /fit/izen getting isekai'd to a world of magic and shit.

Chapter 1 here: https://archiveofourown.org/works/24426631/chapters/58932739

Chapter 2: Encounter

The guards standing at both sides of the southern gate leading into Ringstad were busy passing their shift kicking a stone back and forth between them. The south gate saw the least traffic of the three gates into the city, being closest to the coast and furthest from the main street, so usually only the old or the slow were sent to stand guard there.

One of the guards noticed a person approaching out of the corner of his eye, and looked up from the game he had entertained himself with. He flinched, rubbing his eyes before doing a double take. Coming up the seaside road was a man the size of an oxen, draped in a leather cloak covering his body from head to feet. His large beard was obscuring most of face, but clear, strong eyes were gazing sternly out from underneath his hood. He was holding a large, crude satchel along his body, almost dragging it along the dirt road.

“Halt! Who goes there?” the guardsman called out, instinctively moving his hand to the hilt of his sword. The large man did not break his stride, but instead raised a hand from the inside of his cloak. His bare, muscled arm was the size of a cart axle, and covered in scars.
posts.name: Anonymous

posts.com:
>>55776453
“A traveler, looking for passage into the city, good guardsman,” a deep, monotonous voice answered. His beard shifted, indicating a slight smile, but his eyes remained steely. The guardsman eased up a bit.

“We will have to see some proof of identity. Do you have that on you?”

“...I do not,” the man said, pausing for a bit before continuing, “I have lost most of my belongings.”

“Mugged, were you? Hard to believe bandits would dare mess with a lad of your size. Well, we can issue a temporary entry permit, but it will cost 500 ren. You can pay now, or leave something in deposit at the gatehouse until you’ve sold your wares in the city. We will also need your name, age, and place of birth.”

The large man reached into his satchel and took something out. He approached the guardsman, towering a good head and a half over him, and dropped something into his hands. The guardsman looked down upon a large, red, uncut gemstone.

“My name is Nathaniel Geinz. I am 18 years of age, and I am not sure where I was born.”

-

The narrow streets of Ringstad were a sea of colorful awnings, storefronts, and stalls. Scores of people from all races were going about their business, buying, selling, traversing, or simply relaxing. Natty was towering above them, gazing down the street, trying to eye out a good place to sell the goods he’d brought with him. He pulled back his hood, revealing a mane of thick, brown hair, tied back with a coarse thread. He felt eyes fall upon him from the shadows of the alleyways leading away from the street, but pushed their presence to the back of his mind. He hid his satchel under his cloak and started walking.

One set of eyes followed him more closely than the others. Natty felt someone slip up behind him, and tensed up as a muscular arm slipped over his shoulder.
posts.name: Anonymous

posts.com:
>>55776473
“Yo, lil’ bro. You look lost. First time here?”

Natty looked over on the guy who had so brazenly approached him. He was met with the cocky smile of an older man, scruffy stubble clinging to a cut jawline, with a short, slicked-back haircut complimenting his head. He was wearing a nice linen shirt with a v-cut, tight hoses, and leather shoes. His friendly eyes stared right in to the doubting glare of Natty.

“What do you want?” Natty prodded at him.

“I just thought you could use a guide. You know, to show you the ropes of this town. You wouldn’t want to get taken for a ride by scrupulous types, now would you?” The man looked back over his shoulder and scanned the crowd, as to confirm that they weren’t being followed.

“In my optics, that’s exactly the kind of type you seem to be.” Natty shot back. He gave the man a look up and down, and confirmed that he was indeed rather well built. “But I suppose you could be helpful. What’s your name?”

The man flashed a confident grin.

“My name’s Billy, but my friends call me Aniki.”

“Well Aniki,” Natty said, “you can call me Natty. I don’t suppose you know of an honest pawn shop nearby?”

Before Aniki could answer, a yell rang out from behind them.

“Stop!! Thief!!”

They both turned their heads to see a fuzzy blur bolt right towards them. As it passed by, Natty’s free hand shot out from underneath the cloak and grabbed hold of its tail. The young girl was abruptly yanked onto the ground by her own momentum, the satchel of loot she was carrying flying from her grasp.
posts.name: Anonymous

posts.com:
>>55776486
furiously trying to regain her tail from his hold. Natty just stared coldly at her. She was wearing raggy set of canvas clothes, her bare paws dirty from the street grime.

“Nya don’t just grab a young maiden’s tail like that, nya jackass!” she spat, her cat ears standing up in the air furiously. Aniki, in the meantime, had picked up the bag of loot, and walked over to her.

“Listen here, little baby,” he said, squatting down to meet her eyes, “you’re gonna get hurt if you keep living a dishonest life like that. You should turn a new leaf, you’re still young, and seeing a beauty such as yours rotting up in a jail cell would be a damn shame.” He flashed a smile at her and winked.

The girl’s furry cheeks turned bright red. Gaze turned towards the ground, she finally reclaimed her tail from Natty’s hand, and dashed off into a back alley.

“What was that just now?” Natty asked him.

“Just a bit of the ol’ [Bard] charm.” Aniki said, shooting a wink to Natty. Natty shuddered.

A stout, middle-aged man in fine, embroidered clothes ran up to them. He spent a dozen seconds catching his breath before looking up at them both, his large mustache swaying in the wind.

“Praise the Sun, you caught the thief and reclaimed my wares! But why did you let the rascal run off!?” he huffed at them. Aniki shrugged.

“That kitten learned her lesson. She won’t be stealing no more.” He smiled at the merchant and handed over the satchel to him.

“Well… Okay, if you say so. My name is Fred Gildroy, please, follow me to my store, I must return the favor!”
posts.name: Anonymous

posts.com:
>>55776504
Gildroy’s shop turned out to be an old, renowned establishment that specialized in buying and selling antiques and unica, but also dabbled in other valuable goods. He carefully evaluated the gemstones that Natty brought, and gave him a fair price. On their way out of the store, Natty turned to Gildroy.

“Mr. Gildroy, you seem to be a knowledgeable fellow. Have you ever seen a thing like this before?”

Natty reached into his cloak and took out a huge medallion hanging from a leather string around his neck. It was a large, polished metal disc, cast from black iron, with a wide hole in the middle of it. It had a large groove running inside it, and inside that was inscribed “1.25kg”.

Gildroy looked at it curiously, studying it closely like a piece of rare art.

“Can’t say I have,” he concluded after a while, “but if you will let me make a sketch of it, I will ask around among my fellow antiquarians. Ringstad is a big and well-connected city, someone should know something.”

“Please do.” Natty said, lowering his head in a nod. Gildroy fetched parchment and a piece of charcoal from a desk drawer and made a couple of quick sketches of the medallion before returning the items to the table.

“Check back with me in a couple of days, I’ll have some answers by then.” He said. Natty thanked him, and with that, him and Aniki set out to find a tavern. The sun had sunk over the city, the last streaks of light reflecting off the tiled rooftops.

“I know of an excellent place,” Aniki suggested, “My buddy runs it. He cooks a mean croc steak.”

“Sounds good to me,” Natty replied, “I haven’t have a civilized meal in years.”

“Oh? You gotta elaborate on that. Here, follow me, we can take a shortcut through the back streets.”
posts.name: Anonymous

posts.com:
>>55776529
Natty followed Aniki through the narrow back alleys of Ringstad. Aniki was making pleasant small-talk, but Natty couldn’t shake the feeling that they were being followed. Stepping around a corner, they were suddenly confronted by two hooded figures who had been standing in wait for them.

Aniki stopped dead in his tracks and stared at them. Natty flinched and turned around, only to see two more hooded figures close off the way they came from. They were trapped.

“Who are you?” Aniki asked them, confused.

One of the figures raised its arm, the sleeve of it’s long, black cloak slipping back, revealing a pale, bony hand. It pointed a finger at Natty.

“Hoister,” a ghastly, ethereal voice rang out, “give us the Plate around your neck.”

Natty unconsciously reached for his medallion.

“No way, fag,” Natty shouted at the hooded figure, “What do you want with it, anyway?”

The hooded figure clenched its fist.

“Our Master demands it. If you do not hand it over willingly, we will take it by force.”

The three other figures reached into their cloaks and pulled out a long, curved dagger each. The figure that had spoken to Natty raised its head enough that its face was exposed. Thin, blueish skin clung onto a hairless skull, its eyes shining with a cold, icy glare.

“Uh, Natty, bro,” Aniki started, his voice uncertain, “you might want to rethink your position.”

“No time to think. Back me up!” Natty yelled, releasing the buckle on his cloak. It dropped to the ground, revealing a massive, chiseled body, covered in scars, with a huge set of claw marks running across his back. Apart from a fur loincloth, the only thing he was wearing were a pair of cord sandals, extending all the way up his ankle. In one swift motion, he squatted down as deep as he could, clenching both of his fists and locking them in for a double punch.

“[Hip Drive]!”
posts.name: Anonymous

posts.com:
>>55776542
In a split-second burst of explosiveness, Natty launched himself ahead and smashed both of the hooded figures cutting off their back right in their abdomens. They flew a couple of paces back before slamming against the outer wall of a house, collapsing onto the ground.

The figure that had been speaking let out a coarse hiss and pulled out its own dagger. The remaining figures both launched themselves at Aniki.

“Aniki, run!” Natty yelled, rushing back towards his original position.

“Ffffuck off, you creepy freaks!” Aniki yelled as he high-tailed it . “Natty, do your best, beat those assholes into next week!”

Natty felt a rush come over him. The words from Aniki seemed to lift his spirit to a new level. Invigorated, he caught the dagger of one of the figures with his left hand, and smashed its face into a cobblestone wall with his right hand. The figure fell to the ground, immobile.

Directing his attention towards the last one, he discovered that he was already face-to-face with it. Natty looked down to see the dagger half-way into his stomach. The figure let out a raspy laugh from its toothless mouth.

“You should’ve handed over the Plate while you had the chance, Hoister. Your muscles are no match for steel.” the figure said lowly.

“Oh yeah?” Natty said, smugly, “Think again, asshole. [Pump]!”

Natty’s musculature expanded to double size in a second, eclipsing the entire alleyway. His obliques twitched, and shot the dagger straight back at the figure with incredible power, lodging it right into its chest. The figure fell to the ground.

Natty quickly returned to his normal size, and grabbed the figure by its throat.

“You motherfucker, who sent you!?” Natty demanded.

The figure laughed its raspy laugh, coughing up gray ooze in the process.
posts.name: Anonymous

posts.com:
>>55776564
“You’re too late, Hoister... He Who Has Left Humanity Behind is already aware of your existence. He cannot be stopped. Your fight will be in vain, there will only be more of us coming for you until He gets his hands on the Plate. Expect us...”

With those words, the figure evaporated into a thin, white mist, leaving behind only a pile of bones inside a black cloak. Natty raised himself back up and stared at the remnants. Aniki walked up to him.

“What the fuck was that about?” he asked, staring wide-eyed at Natty.

“I guess I owe you an explanation.” Natty replied, still staring at the pile on the ground. He suddenly grimaced in pain, clutching the now fast bleeding wound on his stomach.

“Oh man, we need to get you to a healer, fast!” Aniki exclaimed in shock, grabbing Natty by the shoulder. Natty raised a hand in objection.

“I’m alright,” Natty winced, “I just need to eat. Help me get to that inn.” Natty painstakingly picked up his cloak and draped himself in it again.

Aniki stared at him in disbelief.

“If you say so, you crazy bastard.” And with that, they hobbled towards the direction they were headed before.

-

An old man was standing behind the counter in a small, empty tavern, polishing a glass with a cloth, when Aniki swung open the front door.

“Ohya, Billy, how good to see yo- Sun Almighty, what in the world happened!?” he exclaimed, coming out from behind the counter. He offered a seat at a table that Aniki dropped Natty into.

“We were waylaid heading here. I’ll explain later. John, get him a raw steak, pronto!”
posts.name: Anonymous

posts.com:
>>55776582
John ran out back and returned with a big chunk of beef, which Natty immediately began devouring. Aniki and John stared in awe as Natty tore off chunks of raw meat with his teeth and swallowed them whole. Slowly, his wounds started to close up, and at the end of the steak, he was fully healed. All that was left was a thin, pink scar on his abdomen.

“[Restitution],” Natty said, wiping blood from his beard with his hand. “One of my skills. It allows me to heal non-fatal wounds if I ingest protein.”

“Protein? What’s that?” John asked.

“Erh, you can think of it like a type of food. Like meat, for instance.”

John stared quizzically at Aniki. Aniki just shrugged and shook his head.

“Natty,” Aniki started, his voice serious, “you really gotta start explaining yourself, bro.”

“I know,” Natty sighed, “Sit down. Innkeeper, please fetch us some food and ale. It’s a long story. It all began five years ago.”

Natty began with the events of that evening when his home was razed by goblins. His grandma had been clutching the medallion he was now wearing when he found her lifeless body. It had seemed like the goblins were trying to take it from her. When Natty had touched the plate, the memories of a lost life had flooded into his brain. The knowledge of a former existence, one in a very advanced, but lifeless, world, where he had spent his time honing his body. Knowledge of advanced training routines, arcane wisdom on food and nutrition, and the discipline to follow through with it all had etched itself into his soul, but in the process, an intolerable amount of pain and loneliness had torn him apart inside. The only thing he could do to not go insane was to flee into the mountains and forests, leaving behind the community he had grown up in.
posts.name: Anonymous

posts.com:
>>55776595
His routines changed with the seasons, but always he trained. In the summer, he hunted and gathered, drying meat for the winter, gathering nuts, while growing fat on fruits and berries and wild game. In the winter, he rested, spending his time meditating in the mountain caves, while slowly burning the layer of fat he’d built during the summer. With his bare hands, he would carve his way deep into the mountains, honing his strength and constitution, while also gathering precious gems for when he would finally return to civilization. Come spring, along with the hibernating animals, he would venture out again to hunt and gather. And so continued the years, until he turned 18, and he returned down the mountain, only to find the village he had grown up in to be in ruins.

By this time in the story, several empty pitchers and plates were already scattered across the wooden table where Natty and Aniki sat. John the innkeeper had stopped polishing glasses, and had placed himself in a nearby chair, listening in on the story.

“I searched the remains of the village for signs of where people might have went, but I found none. So I decided to follow the river to its end, in the hope that I might find people. The river ended at the coast, so I began following the coastal road, until I ended up here. The rest of the story you already know.” Natty concluded and leaned back into his chair, draining his pitcher.
posts.name: Anonymous

posts.com:
>>55776603
Aniki had been listening intensively. John closed his eyes and nodded knowingly.

“That village,” John said, “it was probably razed in a Cooman raid. Those parts of the land have been targeted by the demoness’s armies in the recent years.”

“Coomans?” Natty asked.

“Men driven mad by lust demons. Their sole purpose becomes to ravage anyone and anything they can fornicate with. I wouldn’t wish their wrath on my worst enemies.” John shivered.

Natty could feel anger bubbling up inside him at the thought of such a scourge plaguing his childhood home. A blue ribbon flashed in his memory, and he grit his teeth.

“Aniki.” Natty started.

“Y-yes, bro?”

“Do you know a place where I can get a good workout?”

“I think,” Aniki smiled, “I know exactly what you need. Say, do you know why this city is called Ringstad to begin with?”

- - - - -

And that's the end of chapter 2. Thanks for reading my faggotry. Feedback is, as usual, always welcome. I already have the next few chapters planned out, but ideas are also welcome.

Chapter 2 can also be found here: https://archiveofourown.org/works/24426631/chapters/58939003
